venue.address_1: (entrance at 60 Arch Street, or 201 Devonshire Street)
venue.name: 100 Franklin Street

item.description:
An Irish cultural event of music and drama to celebrate the work of James Joyce, with the Here Comes Everybody Players (Ann Carpenter, Donal O'Sullivan, Jean Sheikh, Cahal Stephens and Josh Way, also featuring tenor Stephen Mark Brown and pianist Linda Papatopoli).

Each June 16th, the work of the great Irish author James Joyce is recognized around the world. "Bloomsday", named after the character Leopold Bloom in Joyce's "Ulysses", celebrates that novel -- set in Dublin on June 16, 1904 -- and Joyce's other literary creations.

All proceeds benefit the Irish International Immigrant Center's programs and services to the immigrant community. To reserve seats, call 617-542-7654 ext. 43, or email reservations [at] iiicenter.org.
item.name: Bloomsday 2012
